Sentencas: A critical factor hampering the deployment of fuel-flexible, low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells (LT-SOFCs) is the long-term stability of the electrode in different gas environments.
Titulo: A Redox-Robust Ceramic Anode-Supported Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Specifically, for state-of-the-art Ni-cermet anodes, reduction/oxidation (redox) cycles during fuel-rich and fuel-starved conditions cause a huge volume change, eventually leading to cell failure.
Titulo: A Redox-Robust Ceramic Anode-Supported Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Here, we report a robust redox-stable SrFe0.2Co0.4Mo0.4O3 (SFCM)/Ce0.9Gd0.1O2 ceramic anode-supported LT-SOFC with high performance and remarkable redox stability.
Titulo: A Redox-Robust Ceramic Anode-Supported Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: The anode-supported configuration tackles the high ohmic loss associated with conventional ceramic anodes, achieving a high open circuit voltage of similar to 0.9 V and a peak power density of 500 mW/cm(2) at 600 degrees C in hydrogen.
Titulo: A Redox-Robust Ceramic Anode-Supported Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: In addition, ceramic anode-supported SOFCs are stable over tens of redox cycles under harsh operating conditions.
Titulo: A Redox-Robust Ceramic Anode-Supported Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Our study reveals that oxygen nonstoichiometry of SFCM compensates for the dimensional changes that occur during redox cycles.
Titulo: A Redox-Robust Ceramic Anode-Supported Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell

Sentencas: Our results demonstrate the potential of all ceramic cells for the next generation of LT-SOFCs.
Titulo: A Redox-Robust Ceramic Anode-Supported Low-Temperature Solid Oxide Fuel Cell
